metadata.title: CVE-2021-33909 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Compliant (focal) - high
metadata.description:
fs/seq_file.c in the Linux kernel 3.16 through 5.13.x before 5.13.4 doesnot properly restrict seq buffer allocations, leading to an integeroverflow, an Out-of-bounds Write, and escalation to root by an unprivilegeduser, aka CID-8cae8cd89f05.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-33909` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-5.4.0-80-generic - 5.4.0-80.90
linux-image-5.4.0-80-generic-lpae - 5.4.0-80.90
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-80-generic - 5.4.0-80.90
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-80-lowlatency - 5.4.0-80.90
No subscription required

linux-image-5.8.0-63-generic - 5.8.0-63.71~20.04.1
linux-image-5.8.0-63-generic-lpae - 5.8.0-63.71~20.04.1
